author: sfgate.com
title: Daily Briefing, Oct. 18
text:
If you missed it ... 
In a week that proved you can spell “Albertsons” without an “IPO,” we also saw:
• Cubs win! Cubs win! Cubs win! Sorry. Not business related. It won’t happen again (in the next paragraph).
•The other company that new Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey , right, leads — Square — filed plans for an IPO, and the paperwork included a huge charitable gesture by Dorsey, a St. Louis native. As VentureBeat reported , Dorsey has established a foundation to help needy communities, starting with Ferguson, Mo., notorious for the police shooting of unarmed black teenager Michael Brown last year. According to the IPO filing, he has given 15 million Square shares to the Start Small Foundation and pledged 40 million in the future.
• Dodgers lose! Dodgers lose! Dodgers lose!
•In a potentially huge technology takeover, Dell and investment firm Silver Lake said they plan to buy EMC for about $67 billion. Palo Alto’s VMware , largely owned by EMC, will continue to be a public company.
•A Reuters story about innovation and intellectual property has this as a headline: “Smart pants tell you when it’s toilet time.” Need we say more?
The Daily Briefing is compiled from San Francisco Chronicle staff and news services. See more items and links at www.sfgate.com . Twitter: @techchronicle
